alert.note: Alert for Coastal Cameron; Inland Cameron (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 09 at 10:30PM CST by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Cameron County through 1115 PM CST... At 1029 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Perkins Middle School to Boca Chica Beach. Movement was southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... South Padre Island, Rancho Viejo, Southmost, Olmito, Port Of Brownsville, Cameron Park, Downtown Brownsville, Brownsville, Lincoln Park and Longoria Elementary School. This includes the following highways... Interstate Highway 69 E between mile markers 1 and 11. US Highway 281 between mile markers 836 and 838. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
